page.title: 12Dedham Art and Craft Centre
page.content: Dedham Congregational Chapel closed in 1980 and reopened on April 9th 1984 as a centre for Arts and Crafts.Visitors come from many places, including Liverpool, Colchester,Reading,Clacton, London, Southampton, Australia, Italy, and America. People often return to collect things they have ordered. It is open every day but it is busiest at weekends. On Saturdays they may have 500 people, on Sundays up to 6 or 700. The exhibitions are stained glass, models, paintings, a toy museum, antiques and bric a brac. Paintings and all sorts of craft models,pottery, leatherwork and flowers are on sale as well. There are classes for crafts like lace-making and corn dollies. There is a wholefood restaurant and it is used for wedding receptions and parties.
